p.s: A topic that is often discussed is the statement from Brian Pollard, that in the twenty-first century the situation has changed, workers are not being exploited by employers, now employers are being exploited by employers.
First of all the benefits of unions and how they improve the working system.
Unions help the employees in a way that they are more powerful and not mistreated by the employers.
This worked out at first but changed over the years.
Another benefit istis that the employees are secured at their working place, because thethey have a contract with the union that they can't get fired easy.
This leads to no productive work from the employees, because they know that they're secured.

The disadvantages of unions are that the workers and the company can't compete against non-union producers, because of the wage the price of the productesproducts or services of the union producer are a lot higher.
In addition to this, the employees have more power than the employers, because they are secured and work however they want.
As a conclusion I have to say that unions are a great idea for the workers but not like how they are right now.
